meanings.sent1: The tour guide leads the group through the museum.
meanings.sent2: The teacher leads the students in a science experiment.
meanings.sent3: The dog leads its owner to the park every morning.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for music leads her to pursue a career in singing.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beacon leads ships safely to shore.

meanings.definition: To be in charge or command
meanings.sent1: The captain leads the crew during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The CEO leads the company with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The superhero leads the fight against evil villains.
meanings.sent4: His charisma leads people to follow his leadership.
meanings.sent5: The general leads the troops into battle.

meanings.definition: To be ahead of others in a race or competition
meanings.sent1: The fastest runner leads the marathon from the start.
meanings.sent2: The champion boxer leads in the final round.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox leads the race against the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her determination leads her to victory in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The skilled chess player leads the match with strategic moves.

meanings.definition: A piece of information that may help solve a crime
meanings.sent1: The detective found a lead that could crack the case.
meanings.sent2: The witness provided a lead to the police about the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious note turned out to be a false lead.
meanings.sent4: The missing key was a crucial lead in solving the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The fingerprint was a valuable lead in identifying the culprit.

meanings.sent1: The artist prefers leads that produce smooth lines in drawings.
meanings.sent2: The mechanical pencil requires a lead refill.
meanings.sent3: The student accidentally broke the lead of the pencil.
meanings.sent4: The carpenter sharpens the lead before marking measurements.
meanings.sent5: The architect uses a lead holder for precise sketching.
